oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bank of Chattanooga one dollar note
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Bank of Chattanooga note would pay the bearer one dollar, "when presented in sums of Five Dollars, or its multiple." The note has a moving train as its central image, with a mechanic depicted in the lower right corner. William D. Fulton signed as cashier for the bank. W. E. McClure signed as president. This fractional currency was among the last issued by the bank in April 1863.
